The ad by the conservative senior citize: the 60 Plus Association, claimed that U.S. Sen. Bill Nelson was the deciding vote for the health care law.
PolitiFact fact: checked the claim made by the U.S. Chamber that Nelson voted to cut $500 billion from Medicare and ruled it Mostly False.
PolitiFact has previously fact: checked similar claims about other Democratic senators, stating that the "deciding" vote for health care was actually cast by U.S. Sen. Sherrod Brown of Ohio and U.S. Sen. Michael Bennet of Colorado.
The final negotiations for the health ca: Joe Lieberman, I-Conn., and Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid, D-Nev., focused on uniting and moving forward rather than singling out Nelson as the deciding vote.
